titleproper.value:
Guide to the John McLaughlin 1981 Hunger Strike Ephemera Collection

This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2015-08-06T14:37-0400</date>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

unittitle.value: John McLaughlin 1981 Irish Hunger Strike Ephemera Collection

extent.value: in 1 manuscript box and 2 oversize folders

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: The collection, collected by John McLaughlin, consists of articles, newspaper clippings and posters related to the Irish Hunger Strikes and other Irish Republicanism activities. Both the American and Irish press are represented.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Collection name; Collection number; box number; folder number; Archives of Irish America, Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Materials were collected by John McLaughlin and donated to the Archives of Irish America in 2000. The accession number associated with this collection is 1997.014.
The materials in this collection were collected by Irish American political activist John McLaughlin.

The collection contains ephemeral material related to and documenting reaction to the Hunger Strikes of 1981 and and to the organization Irish Northern Aid. Contents include newspaper clippings and magazine articles, and posters relating to the Hunger Strikers at Long Kesh Prison.

subject.value: Irish Americans |z New York (State) |z New York |x Political activities.
